name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.. Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add ginger and garlic, sauté until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Pour in soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes.

name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add garlic and red pepper flakes, and sauté until fragrant.
Toss cooked spaghetti into the garlic oil, add chopped parsley, and mix well.
Serve hot, garnished with Parmesan cheese if desired.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and tikka masala spice mix for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until fully cooked.
In a pan, sauté onions in ghee, add tomato puree, and simmer.
Add cream, grilled chicken, and cook for 10 more minutes.
Serve with fresh cilantro on top.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu
instructions: Stir-fry tofu in sesame oil until golden, set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic and ginger, then add all the vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Add soy sauce and cornstarch slurry (if using) for a thicker sauce, and toss in the tofu.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups Tomato puree (or 4 large tomatoes, finely blended)
instructions: If the paneer is store-bought, soak it in warm water for 10-15 minutes to soften it. Drain and set aside.

In a large pan, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn soft and golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, and cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant.

Add the tomato puree to the pan, and cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes reduce and the oil starts to separate. Add the red chili powder, turmeric, ground coriander, and salt, and mix well.
Stir in the cream and sugar (if using), and let the sauce simmer for another 5 minutes until it thickens. Crush the fenugreek leaves between your hands and add them to the sauce for extra flavor.

Add the paneer cubes to the sauce, gently stirring to coat them with the rich gravy. Let the paneer simmer in the sauce for 5-7 minutes to absorb the flavors. Add the remaining tablespoon of butter for extra richness and sprinkle garam masala over the dish.
Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with naan, roti, or jeera rice.

name: Chicken Alfredo
instructions: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the sauce, tossing to combine. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: On a large plate, alternate layers of sliced tomatoes and mozzarella.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the layers.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: In a skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water as per package instructions. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Fill taco shells with beef mixture and top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream.

name: Shrimp Scampi
instructions: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Pour in white wine and lemon juice, simmer for 3 minutes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the shrimp mixture and garnish with parsley.

name: Falafel Wrap
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, and salt. Pulse until a coarse mixture forms.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Fry in oil until golden brown on all sides.
Serve in pita bread or wraps with tahini sauce.

name: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place lemon slices on top of the fillets.
Grill for about 6-8 minutes per side or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with fresh dill before serving.

name: Chickpea Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger; cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add curry powder and chickpeas to the pot, stirring to combine well.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes until thickened.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.
